result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Justin S Volkaitis

records.addlTxt: Final pre-trial on November 7, 2022 at 09:00 am.

10:10 AM Prosecuting attorney Craig Lambert in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Justin S Volkaitis in court.  Attorney Emily M Nolan-Plutchak in court for Justin S Volkaitis.
Final pre-trial scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
10:28 AM Prosecuting attorney Daniel McGrath in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Justin S Volkaitis in court. Court questions defendant regarding non-representation. Court will proceed with the option of having the matter reheard.  Officer Klug is sworn and questioned by Attorney McGrath. Testifies to being dispatched to a business regarding a complaint of an intoxicated person. Witness identifies the defendant in the courtroom.  Testifies to the results of the PBT.  Testifies that defendant was on bond in a Marathon County case with an absolute sobriety condition.

Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and that the defendant committed it. Bond is continued.
Arraignment scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Absolute sobriety. No possession of alcohol.  $2,500.
Preliminary hearing and Arraignment on June 22, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Absolute sobriety. No possession of alcohol.

1:49 PM Defendant Justin S Volkaitis appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Daniel McGrath in court for State of Wisconsin. Laura Federico appears in court for the defendant. 
Court finds probable cause to continue this matter. This will be bound over for preliminary hearing and arraignment.
